qas.question: Who claimed the right to name Neptune?
What did the discoverer want to name Neptune first?
What country approved Neptune's first name?
What first introduced Neptune and Uranus's names?
Who did not approve of the first name for Neptune?
What name was opposed by the french?
What name did the French Bureau des Longitudes approve?
What did Le Verrier want to name Uranus?
Who refused the right to name Neptune?
What did the discoverer want to name Uranus first?
What country disapproved Neptune's first name?
What first introduced Jupiter and Uranus's names?

context: Claiming the right to name his discovery, <a0_0><b8_0><b9_0>Le Verrier<b9_0/><b8_0/><a0_0/> quickly proposed the name <b6_0>Neptune<b6_0/> for this new planet, though falsely stating that this had been officially approved by the <a4_0>French Bureau des Longitudes<a4_0/>. In October, he sought to name the planet <a1_0><b5_0>Le Verrier<a1_0/>,<b5_0/> after himself, and he had loyal support in this from the observatory director, François Arago. This suggestion met with stiff resistance outside <a2_0><b10_0>France<b10_0/><a2_0/>. <a3_0><b11_0>French almanacs<b11_0/><a3_0/> quickly reintroduced the name <b7_0>Herschel<b7_0/> for Uranus, after that planet's discoverer Sir William Herschel, and Leverrier for the new planet.
